Detailed Description

cvmx_sriomaint::_m2s_bar1_start1

The starting SRIO address to forwarded to the BAR1 memory space. This register specifies the SRIO address mapped to the BAR1 space. If the transaction has not already been mapped to SRIO maintenance space through the SRIOMAINT_LCS_BA[1:0] registers and the address bits do not match enabled BAR0 addresses and if ENABLE is set and the addresses match the BAR1 addresses then SRIO memory transactions will map to OCTEON memory space specified by SRIOMAINT()_BAR1_IDX[31:0] registers. The BARSIZE field determines the size of BAR1, the entry select bits, and the size of each entry.

* A 34-bit address matches BAR1 when it matches SRIO_Address[33:20+BARSIZE] while all the other bits in ADDR48, ADDR64 and ADDR66 are zero.

* A 50-bit address matches BAR1 when it matches SRIO_Address[49:20+BARSIZE] while all the other bits of ADDR64 and ADDR66 are zero.

* A 66-bit address matches BAR1 when all of SRIO_Address[65:20+BARSIZE] match all corresponding address CSR field bits.

Note: ADDR48 and ADDR64 fields are located in SRIOMAINT()_M2S_BAR1_START0. The ADDR32/66 fields of this register are writeable over SRIO if SRIO()_ACC_CTRL[DENY_ADR1] is zero. The remaining fields are writeable over SRIO if SRIO()_ACC_CTRL[DENY_BAR1] is zero.
